summary: Chrome Container App Launch and Window Visibility

message.content:
this error keeps happening i think its due to terminal state saves? or maybe not Last login: Fri Aug  1 22:55:31 on ttys007
dezmondhollins@Mac ~ % cd /Users/dezmondhollins/my-web-app/chrome-container-app && npm start

> slither-chrome-container@1.0.0 start
> electron .

[62650:0801/230531.561551:ERROR:process_singleton_posix.cc(186)] write() failed: Broken pipe (32)
üõ°Ô∏è Setting up signal handlers for terminal state persistence...
‚úÖ Signal handlers setup complete

content.text: I'll help you diagnose this error. The "Broken pipe" error from `process_singleton_posix.cc` typically occurs when Electron detects another instance is already running or there's a stale lock file.

input.command: ps aux | grep -i electron | grep -v grep

input.description: Check for lock files in app data directory

input.description: Kill all Electron processes for chrome-container-app

Now try starting the app again:

content.text:
Good! The app is now starting. The initial error was due to:
1. An existing Electron instance that was still running
2. A stale SingletonLock file
3. An empty/corrupted terminal-state.json file

The solution was to:
- Kill the existing Electron processes
- Remove the SingletonLock file
- Remove the corrupted terminal-state.json file

The app is now running successfully, though it's showing an error trying to connect to Chrome DevTools on port 9222 (which is expected if Chrome isn't running yet with remote debugging enabled).
Let me check what Electron processes are running and kill them more specifically:

input.command: ps aux | grep -i electron | grep -v grep

content.text: I see there's a Cursor (Electron-based) process. Let me kill all Electron-related processes more forcefully:

input.description: Force kill all processes named Electron

content.content: No matching processes belonging to you were found

content.text: Let me check if the chrome-container-app processes were already killed:

input.description: Check for any electron or chrome-container processes

content.text: All Electron processes have been successfully killed. The chrome-container-app is no longer running.
